text: Vladimir Aceti (born 16 October 1998) is an Italian sprinter, specialized in the 400 metres. ==Biography== From Russian origins adopted when he was 5 by an Italian family. He has blonde hair. His first club was Atletica Vis Nova of Giussano. On 27 May 2017, he established his personal best in Oordegem at 46.30, the second best ever for an Italian junior. On 2 July 2017, he finished second during Italian Championships in Trieste, with 46.40. On 22 July 2017, he established the New Junior National Record, winning the Gold medal at 2017 European Championships U20 in Grosseto, and also the Gold medal in the race of 4x400 m (WU20L). ==Achievements== {| class="wikitable sortable" width=65% style="font-size:90%; text-align:center;" |- !Year!!Competition!!Venue!!Position!!Event!!Time!!Notes |- |2017 | align=left|European Junior Championships | align=left| Grosseto |1st |4×400 m relay |3:08.68 |(WU20L) |- | 2019 | align=left|European Indoor Championships | align=left| Glasgow | 6th | 4×400 m relay | 3:09.48 | |} ==National titles== * Italian Athletics Championships ** 4x400 metres: 2019 ==See also== * Italian national track relay team ==References== ==External links== * * Athlete profile at FIDAL web site Category:1998 births Category:Athletics competitors of Fiamme Gialle Category:Italian male sprinters Category:Living people
title: Vladimir Aceti
